bibl.title: PDuk inv. 971 verso + PKöln I 22: Homer, Iliad 1.528-559.
bibl.note: P. Duke Inv. 971 and P. Köln I, 22 come from the same papyrus roll. The two fragments preserve sections of thirty-two lines of book one of the Iliad written against the fibres on the back of a "census declaration" (likely from a tÒmow sugkollÆsimow). Provenance unknown, third century. <tomos sugkollesimos>
LUNDON John, PDuk inv. 971 verso + PKöln I 22: Homer, Iliad 1.528-559.
141.4 P. Duke Inv. 971 verso + P. Köln I, 22
